info.title: Version Management
info.description:
**Below is detail each field for Version Management** | Field | Type | Format | Description | | -------------- | -------- | -------- | ---------------------------------- | | _id | string | *24 characters of hexadecimal* | Unique identifier for the vehicle
that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2`| | platform | string | Enumeration:
`Android`, `IOS`, `Web`, `Web-mileapp` | This is the platform option to choose which platform gets the version update `Android, IOS, Web, Web-mileapp`
**Example**: `Web-mileapp` | | versionNumber | integer | Integer with auto increment value for ex: `1` , `2` & up to infinity | | versionName | string | | Required string but same as **versionNumber** this is increment with format (Major, Minor, Patches)
**Example**: `v3.1.1` | | releaseTime | datetime | Format: `Y-m-d H:i:s` | **Example**: 2023-03-24 23:59:59 | | categoryUpdate | string | Enumeration:
`flexible`, `immediate` | `flexible` for update categories with low urgency & `immediate` for update categories with high urgency ,
effects on mobile will appear notifications must update the application
**Default**: flexible | | docLink | string | *URL format* | This is to input the release notes document url, currently the **Click Up Document** link.
**Example :** https://doc.clickup.com/3837933/p/h/3n3zd-96542/e197dd0adc56139 | | changeLog | string | | This is the log record of any changes ,use separator for point with `;`. | | tags | array | Enumeration :
`major update`, `minor update`, `new feature`, `feature improvement`, `bug fix`, `web`, `api` , `android` , `ios` | This is the tags to make it easier for users to categorize these changes
**Example**: `new feature` | \n \n

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description:
**Below is detail each field for Body Response API Version Management** | Field | Description | Required | |---|---|---| | organizationId | Unique ID from the organization indicating specific version data for a particular organization. And if its value is null, then the version data applies to the general or all organizations
**Example**: `65c32cd21d3200002d00340d` | optional | | platform | This is the platform option to choose which platform gets the version update `Android, IOS, Web, Web-mileapp`
**Example**: `Web-mileapp` | Required | | versionNumber | Integer increment value for ex: `1` , `2` & up to infinity | optional | | versionName | Required string but same as **versionNumber** this is increment with format (Major, Minor, Patches)
**Example**: `v3.1.1` | required | | versionData | The integer increment value based on the `versionNumber` to indicate that the data version has been updated. | optional | | releaseTime | **Example**: 2023-03-24 23: 59: 59 | required | | categoryUpdate | `flexible` for update categories with low urgency & `immediate` for update categories with high urgency ,
effects on mobile will appear notifications must update the application
**Default**: flexible | required | | docUrl | This is to input the release notes document url, currently the **Click Up Document** link.
**Example :** https://doc.clickup.com/3837933/p/h/3n3zd-96542/e197dd0adc56139 | required | | changeLog | This is the log record of any changes ,use separator for point with `;`. | required | | tags | Select multiple tags enumeration :
`major update`, `minor update`, `new feature`, `feature improvement`, `bug fix`, `web`, `api` , `android` , `ios` | required |

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the version that generated by system.
**Example**: `62ce3918d3f3e1681a3a54b2`

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the version that generated by system.
**Example**: `62ce3918d3f3e1681a3a54b2`

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description:
This is the platform option to choose which platform gets the version update `Android, IOS, Web, Web-mileapp`
**Example**: `Web-mileapp`

last_required.description: Most recent version with categoryUpdate = 'immediate'. Returns null if no mandatory updates exist. Use this to check if user needs to force update.
